intro: Miconia dolichodons, commonly known as the long-stalked miconia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release small, winged seeds when mature. Miconia dolichodons is often found in moist, shaded understory habitats within tropical forests.
